intro: Ebraxis antirrhina, commonly known as the slender snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the genus Ebraxis within the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
